contextId.information: Desiring to please someone is spoken of as inclining the heart toward that person. AT: "make us want to please him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The eyes and heart are synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "I will protect and care for it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: My eyes and my heart will be there

contextId.information: The words "all Israel" refer to the army of Israel. AT: "Joab and all of the Israelite army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"David" refers to all of David's forces. AT: "when David's army overcame" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here the word "days" refers to a period of time and "Solomon" refers to everything under his control. AT: "all the time when Solomon had control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "my bones" represents his entire body. AT: "Lay my dead body beside his bones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Lay my bones beside his bones

contextId.information: The word "feet" here is a synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "when you enter the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: when your feet enter the city

contextId.information: The heart represents the whole person. AT: "Abijah was not devoted ... as David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: his heart was not devoted ... as the heart of David

contextId.information: "The phrase "all Israel" is a generalization that represents the  many soldiers of Israel. AT: "Nadab and the many soldiers of Israel" or "Nadab and the army of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

Both times this phrase is used, it represents the army of Israel. Here the word "all" is a generalization meaning "most." AT: "all the army of Israel" or "most of the soldiers in the army of Israel" or "the army of Israel"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"The land" is synecdoche for all the people living there. AT: "of the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Israel" represents its armed forces by synecdoche. AT: "to fight against the army of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Samaria" was the capital city of the kingdom of Israel and here represents the entire nation. AT: "king of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "heart" refers to the entire person and his emotions. AT: "Why are you so sad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Why is your heart so sad

contextId.information: Here the word "days" represents the entire lifetime of a person. AT: "during his lifetime ... during his son's lifetime" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: in his days ... in his son's day
